name: src/js/BOM.js
BOMEntry
description: This class defines a BOMEntry object which is used to define one entry in a bill of materials.

name: constructor
description: The constructor returns a new blank BOMEntry object.

name: BOMitemName
description: The name of the item.

name: numberNeeded
description: The number of this item needed.

name: costUSD
description: The cost of one of this item in USD.

name: source
description: A link to where to purchase the item.

name: convertLinks
description: Takes a link and converts it to be an affiliate link if it should be.

params.name: link
params.description: The link to check.

name: src/js/NewMenu.js
ele
description: Html element that contains the circular menu

name: src/js/alwaysOneFreeInput.js
howManyInputPortsAvailable
description: Computes the number of inputs which are curently available on a target atom.

params.name: target
params.description: The atom which should have it's number of inputs computed.

name: deleteEmptyPort
description: Deletes one free input from an atom which has more than one free input available.

params.name: target
params.description: The atom which should have one input deleted (if there are more than two free).

name: findHighestInput
description: Finds the highest number input currently used by this atom

params.name: target
params.description: The atom which should be inspected for inputs.

name: addOrDeletePorts
description: Adds or deletes inputs from a target atom until there is exactly one input available.

params.name: target
params.description: The atom which should have it's number of inputs adjusted.

name: src/js/globalvariables.js
GlobalVariables
description: This class defines things which are made available to all objects which import it. It is a singlton which means that each time it is imported the same instance is made available so if it is written to in one place, it can be read somewhere else.

name: constructor
description: The constructor creates a new instance of the Global Variables object.

name: canvas
description: The canvas object on which the atoms are drawn.

name: c
description: The 2D reference to the canvas object on which the atoms are drawn.

name: availableTypes
description: An array of all of the available types of atoms which can be placed with a right click.

name: touchInterface
description: A flag to indicate if the program is running with a touch interface. Set in flowDraw.js.

name: cad
description: The replicad object which is used to interact with the replicad worker.

name: totalAtomCount
description: A total of the number of atoms in this project

name: numberOfAtomsToLoad
description: A counter used during the loading process to keep track of how many atoms are still to be loaded.

name: fork
description: A flag to indicate if the project is a fork.

name: ctrlDown
description: A flag to indicate if command is pressed

name: atomsSelected
description: A variable to save array to be copied

name: circleSegmentSize
description: The size (in mm) of segments to use for circles.

name: displayProcessing
description: A flag to indicate if a display value is currently being processed.

name: displayGrid
description: A flag to indicate if a grid should be displayed behind the shape

name: displayAxis
description: A flag to indicate if the edges of the shape should be displayed.

name: displayTriangles
description: A flag to indicate if the display should show axis.

name: displayShortcuts
description: A flag to indicate if shortcuts should be displayed.

name: displayEdges
description: A flag to indicate if the faces of the shape should be displayed.

name: recentMoleculeRepresentation
description: An array to keep track of recent molecule changes to allow undo to revert back recently deleted molecules.

name: limitedEvaluate
description: An evaluator for strings as mathmatical equations which is sandboxed and secure.

name: constrainToCanvasBorders
description:
Snaps the given x,y coordinates to the nearest point within the canvas boundaries. Where x
and y are width fraction and heigh fraction respectively.

return.description: a tuple of [snapped x position, snapped y position], both in fractional position

name: constrainToCanvasBordersPixels
description:
Snaps the given x,y coordinates to the nearest point within the canvas boundaries. Where x
and y are measuring pixels from the top-left of the canvas.

return.description: a tuple of [snapped x position, snapped y position], both in pixels

name: widthToPixels
description: A function to generate a pixel value for 0-1 location on screen depending on screen width.

name: pixelsToWidth
description: A function to generate a 0-1 value from pixels for location on screen depending on screen width.

name: heightToPixels
description: Convert from a fractional height value to a number of pixels.

name: pixelsToHeight
description: Convert from a pixel position or distance to a fraction of the page height between 0 and 1 inclusive.

name: toBinaryStr
description: A function to encode strings that contain characters outside of latin range so they can pass through btoa

params.name: The
params.description: string to encode

name: writeToDisplay
description: A function which reads the value of a unique ID and passes to display

params.name: The
params.description: unique ID to read from

name: generateUniqueID
description: A function to generate a unique ID value.

name: incrementVariableName
description: A function to avoid repeating input names in a molecule

name: distBetweenPoints
description: Computes the distance between two points on a plane. This is a duplicate of the one in utils which should probably be deleted.

params.name: x1
params.description: The x cordinate of the first point.

params.name: x2
params.description: The x cordinate of the second point.

params.name: y1
params.description: The y cordinate of the first point.

params.name: y2
params.description: The y cordinate of the second point.

name: globalVariables
description: Because we want global variables to be the same every time it is imported we export an instance of global variables instead of the constructor.

content: # A web based CAD program for cooperative design. Abundance breaks with the tradition of CAD programs which inherit from drawing programs and instead inherits from logical languages like programming. This allows it to be a CAD program which can have language like features such as importing modules, version control, and collaboration. ## Login with Github After the initial screen prompts you to login with Github, all the projects you create on Abundance will be stored as Github Repositories but you can always search for them and find them through the Abundance Platform. # Projects Screen Choose whether you want to create a new project, go into one of your existing projects or take a look at a project that someone else created. If you own the selected project you will be redirected to Create Mode. If the project belongs to someone else you will be redirected to Run Mode where you can choose to fork the project to modify it or simply download it. # Create Mode ## Flow A 3D model within Maslow Create is composed of interconnected nodes called Atoms and Molecules which are linked together through connectors. An atom is a shape or an operation you can perform on a shape (ie circle or translate). A molecule can contain any number of atoms in a configuration (ie generate a table leg). Think of Atoms as the built-in functions of a programming language and molecules as the functions you create. Each atom has attachment points to which connectors can attach. ## Layout of the program Create Mode has two main areas to interface with. Along the top of the screen is the logical flow of the design. In the lower portion you can see the rendering area where a 3D view of your model will appear. In the lower left is a cluster of menus that lets you do things like change the parameters and dimensions of the selected shape. ## Atom Menu To see and place the available atoms on your flow screen start by right-clicking anywhere within the flow screen area to spawn the circular atom menu. Move your cursor around to spawn the sub-menus and click on the atom you want to place. The atoms available in the circular menu are divided into 6 categories: ### Shapes: - Regular Polygon - Circle - Rectangle - Text - Molecule ### Interactions: - Intersection - Difference - Join - Loft - ShrinkWrap ### Actions: - Color - Rotate - Extrude - Move - Genetic Algorithm (disabled) ### Inputs: - Input - Constant - Equation - Code ### Tags: - ReadMe - Add-Bom-Tag - Tag - Extract Tag - CutLayout ### Import-Export: - GCode - Import - Export - Github Molecule ## Shapes ### Regular Polygon The regular polygon atom creates a regular polygon shape. Regular polygons are regularly extruded to create a 3D shape. ### Circle The circle atom creates a circle sketch on the XY plane. Circle shapes are commonly extruded to create cylinders. ### Rectangle The rectangle atom creates a rectangle sketch on the XY plane. Rectangles are commonly extruded to make a 3D shape. ### Text The text atom creates a basic sketch on the XY plane with a string of your choosing. Text is commonly extruded to make a 3D shape. ### Molecule The molecule atom can contain any number of atoms in a useful configuration. To add inputs to the molecule, place an input atom within it. ## Interactions ### Intersection The intersection atom computes the area of intersection of two shapes and creates a new shape out of that area. ### Difference The difference atom subtracts one shape from another. ### Join #### Assembly The assembly selector allows multiple shapes to be combined into one unit called an assembly. The order in which atoms are combigned matters because where shapes intersect shapes earlier in the order subtract from shapes later in the order. For example if you have a bolt which needs to create a hole in a part you should assemble first the part and then the bolt. #### Fusion The fusion selector atom allows multiple shapes to be combined into one unit. The shapes are fused, become one and are inseparable from then on. ### Shrinkwrap The shrinkwrap atom combines multiple sketches into a single shape as if they had been shrinkwrapped. This is useful for creating shapes that would be difficult to create in other ways. ### Loft ## Actions ### Color The color atom gives color to a 2D or 3D shape. ### Move The move atom moves a 3D shape in 3D space or a 2D shape in 2D space. { ### Extrude The Extrude atom takes a 2D shape and makes it 3D. ### Rotate The rotate atom rotates a shape along any of its three axis. ## Tags ### README The README atom provides notes to the next person reading the project. The text of the readme input is added to the readme page of the project (similar to this page you are reading now). ### Tag The tag atom adds a tag to a part which can be later used to retrieve that part from an assembly. ### Add BOM Tag The Add BOM Tag atom tags a part with a bill of materials item. This item will appear in the project bill of materials one time each time the tagged part appears in the final shape. For example if you have a table leg that needs four bolts, and the final model has four table legs the bolt will automatically appear in the final bill of materials 16 times. ## Inputs ### Input The input atom lets you define which variables are inputs to your program. They function similar to constants, however when you share your project, the person on the other end will have the ability to change the values of the inputs. Inputs placed within a molecule will add inputs to that molecule up one level. ### Code The code atom allows you to enter arbitrary replicad code. For all available methods see replicad.xyz ### Constant The constant atom defines a constant number that can be used to control multiple inputs. ### Equation The equation Atom lets you perform basic math operations on numbers produced by constants. ## Import/Export ### Gcode ### Import The Import atom allows you to upload a STL, SVG, or STEP file. Complex models might take a long time to compute. ### Export The export atom tags a part for export. An Export atom lets you download the selected part in a file format of your choosing and makes that part available for download in Run Mode ### GitHub Molecule The GitHub atom type is not directly available. By clicking on the GitHub tab when placing a new Atom you can search for and add any other Abundance project to your project as a molecule. ## Output The output atom cannot be directly placed however, each molecule has one output that can't be deleted. Connect a shape to the output of a molecule to make that shape available one level up. The output of the top-level molecule is the output of the project. # Run Mode If you are not the owner of a project or are not logged in, you can still see a project in Run Mode. # Development You can read the complete documentation at ----(Documentation pending) ## How To Setup 1. Clone the repo: git clone https://github.com/BarbourSmith/Abundance.git 2. Install dependencies: npm install 3. Run webpack: npm start Your canvas piece should open up automatically at http://localhost:4444

{
  "homepage": "https://alzatin.github.io",
  "name": "replicad-app-example",
  "version": "0.14.6",
  "description": "A simple React app based on replicad.",
  "private": true,
  "scripts": {
    "start": "vite",
    "predeploy": "npm run build",
    "deploy": "gh-pages -d dist",
    "build": "vite build && cp ./dist/index.html ./dist/404.html",
    "serve": "vite preview"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "-": "^0.0.1",

    "@react-three/drei": "^9.115.0",
